definition: more than one can attend to (idiom)/deluged (with inquiries etc)/overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
surname Ying
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
(negative prefix)/not/no
leisure

sentences.chinese: 来访者多得让他应接不暇。

sentences.english: The firm has more clients than it can take care of.
sentences.chinese: 这家商行的主顾多得应接不暇。

sentences.english: You do not have to take in new orders.
sentences.chinese: 新的定货单实在使他们应接不暇了。

sentences.english: We were inundated with requests for further information.
sentences.chinese: 要求提供进一步信息的人极多，我们应接不暇。

sentences.english: Three emergency cases came into the hospital at the same time and the doctors really had their hands full.
sentences.chinese: 三个急诊病人被同时送到医院，医生们真是应接不暇。

sentences.english: He is besieged with visitors from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 海外客人纷至遝来，弄得他应接不暇。

sentences.english: We have been deluged with applications for the job.
sentences.chinese: 申请这个工作的求职信使我们应接不暇。

sentences.english: The season swamps us under wave after wave of produce.
sentences.chinese: 这个季节一波一波的农产品让我们应接不暇。

sentences.english: They have more business than they can do now.
sentences.chinese: 现在他们的生意是应接不暇。

definition: lit. too much for the eye to take in (idiom); a feast for the eyes
to be dazzled
to come one after the other
to come thick and fast (idiom)
to struggle to cope (with a situation)/to be at one's wits' end
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
in unbroken succession (idiom)
lit. badly burned about the head (from trying to put out a fire) (idiom)/fig. hard-pressed/under pressure (from a heavy workload, creditors etc)
to be pestered beyond endurance
(idiom) terribly busy/up to one's ears in work
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
(idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
not know where to start
one after another (idiom)/in quick succession
